name: Conversions with customary units of capacity

skills.name: Converting between customary units of capacity

explanations.A: I think you've multiplied by 16. But, 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces. Therefore, you need to know how many times 32 divides into 96.
explanations.B: 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces. 96 ÷ 32 = 3. Therefore, 96 fluid ounces = 3 quarts.
explanations.C: You've divided by 8. But, 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces.
explanations.D: I think you've multiplied by 32. But, 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces. Therefore, you need to know how many times 32 divides into 96.

explanations.A: I think you've multiplied by 32. But, 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces. Therefore, you need to know how many times 32 divides into 64.
explanations.B: I think you've multiplied by 16. But, 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces. Therefore, you need to know how many times 32 divides into 64.
explanations.C: 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces. 64 ÷ 32 = 2. Therefore, 64 fluid ounces = 2 quarts.
explanations.D: You've divided by 8. But, 1 quart = 32 fluid ounces.

explanations.A: You've divided by 8. But, 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces.
explanations.B: I think you've multiplied by 16. But, 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces. Therefore, you need to know how many times 16 divides into 30.
explanations.C: You've divided by 10. But, 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces.
explanations.D: 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces. 30 ÷ 16 = 1 remainder 14. Therefore, 30 fl oz = 1 pint 14 fl oz.

explanations.A: You've divided by 10. But, 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces.
explanations.B: 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces. 40 ÷ 16 = 2 remainder 8. Therefore, 40 fl oz = 2 pints 8 fl oz.
explanations.C: You've divided by 8. But, 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces.
explanations.D: I think you've multiplied by 16. But, 1 pint = 16 fluid ounces. Therefore, you need to know how many times 16 divides into 40.

explanations.A: You've divided by 8. But, 1 gallon = 4 quarts.
explanations.B: 1 gallon = 4 quarts. 19/4 = 4 and 3/4, therefore 19 quarts = 4 and 3/4 gallons.
explanations.C: I think you know that you need to divide 19 by 4 (1 gallon = 4 quarts). And that the numbers in the 4 times table are: 4,8,12,16,20. But, 4 only goes into 19, four times (4 x 4 = 16).
explanations.D: I think you've multiplied by 4. But, 1 gallon = 4 quarts. Therefore, you need to know how many times 4 divides into 19.

explanations.A: I think you know that you need to divide 15 by 4 (1 gallon = 4 quarts). And that the numbers in the 4 times table are: 4,8,12,16. But, 4 only goes into 15, three times (4 x 3 = 12).
explanations.B: You've divided by 8. But, 1 gallon = 4 quarts.
explanations.C: 1 gallon = 4 quarts. 15/4 = 3 and 3/4, therefore 15 quarts = 3 and 3/4 gallons.
explanations.D: I think you've multiplied by 4. But, 1 gallon = 4 quarts. Therefore, you need to know how many times 4 divides into 15.

explanations.A: 1 gallon = 8 pints. To calculate 10 pints in gallons, simplify 10/8 and compare this with 1 and 1/4 gallons.
explanations.B: 1 gallon = 8 pints. To calculate 10 pints in gallons, simplify 10/8 and compare this with 1 and 1/4 gallons.
explanations.C: 1 gallon = 8 pints. 10/8 = 5/4 = 1 and 1/4. Therefore, 10 pints = 1 and 1/4 gallons.
explanations.D: We can compare these 2 quantities, we need to use the fact that 1 gallon = 8 pints. To calculate 10 pints in gallons, simplify 10/8 and compare this with 1 and 1/4 gallons.

explanations.A: 1 gallon = 8 pints. To calculate 20 pints in gallons, simplify 20/8 and compare this with 2 and 1/4 gallons.
explanations.B: 1 gallon = 8 pints. 20/8 = 5/2 = 2 and 1/2. Therefore, 20 pints = 2 and 1/2 gallons which is greater than 2 and 1/4 gallons.
explanations.C: 1 gallon = 8 pints. To calculate 20 pints in gallons, simplify 20/8 and compare this with 2 and 1/4 gallons.
explanations.D: We can compare these 2 quantities, we need to use the fact that 1 gallon = 8 pints. To calculate 20 pints in gallons, simplify 20/8 and compare this with 2 and 1/4 gallons.

explanations.A: 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. And 120 fl oz. is less than 128 fl oz. So, how does 120 fl oz. compare with 1 gallon?
explanations.B: 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. Therefore, 1 gallon is greater than 120 fl oz. 1 gallon ＞ 120 fl oz
explanations.C: 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. And 120 fl oz. is less than 128 fl oz. So, how does 120 fl oz. compare with 1 gallon?
explanations.D: We can compare these 2 quantities. 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. And 120 fl oz. is less than 128 fl oz. So, how does 120 fl oz. compare with 1 gallon?

explanations.A: 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. Therefore, 5 gallons = 5 x 128 = 640 fl oz. 640 fl oz is less than 650 fl oz therefore we need to put < symbol in the box!
explanations.B: 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. Use this to work out how many fl oz in 5 gallons then compare this value to 650 fl oz...
explanations.C: 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. Use this to work out how many fl oz in 5 gallons then compare this value to 650 fl oz...
explanations.D: We can compare these 2 quantities. 1 gallon = 128 fl oz. Use this to work out how many fl oz in 5 gallons then compare this value to 650 fl oz...
